availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Webb Scott (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, physician and state surgeon general)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, physician and state surgeon general. Chillicothe, Ohio native. Son of Lucy Webb. Married Mary Buchannan in St. Louis, Missouri, on April 30, 1857. Father of Lucy Scott, Mary Scott, and Anna Scott. Attended Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky in 1850. Physician in Fayette County, Kentucky in 1850. Physician in Louisville in 1860. Employed Johana Ryan as a domestic in Louisville in 1860. Employed Sallie Malone as a domestic in Louisville in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a lieutenant colonel from March 1862 to March 1863. Appointed Surgeon General for the state of Kentucky in September 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 213A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, 4th Ward Louisville, p. 73.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0057.
Maysville Weekly Bulletin (Maysville, Kentucky) 15 October 1863.
“Deaths,” The Journal of the American Medical Association Vol. 60 (May 3, 1913), p. 1376.
Find A Grave, "Dr Isaac Webb Scott (1826-1913)," Memorial #8889294, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8889294# (accessed on June 15, 2018).
